definition: name/designation/item/rubric/(formal usage) fame
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
eye/item/section/list/catalogue/table of contents/order (taxonomy)/goal/name/title
names of many kinds (idiom); items of every description
to fabricate excuses (idiom)/to concoct various items (e.g. to pad an expense account)

sentences.english: Naturally, the process of coming up with this list wasn't always easy.
sentences.chinese: 當然，拿出這份書名目錄的過程中並非總是很容易的。

sentences.english: The glitzy training centres are only the beginning.
sentences.chinese: 巧立名目的各個培訓中心剛剛開始創立。

sentences.english: The names of items are too numerous to enumerate.
Fourth, all sorts of pretexts to collect fees.
sentences.chinese: 巧立名目，收取各項費用。

sentences.english: Have you checked in the catalog under author and title?
sentences.chinese: 你查過作者和書名目錄了嗎？

sentences.english: Beds also go by different names.
sentences.chinese: 旅館裏的牀亦名目繁多。

sentences.english: The Mid-Atlantic Ridge project collected 80000 specimens from this undersea mountain range.
sentences.chinese: 中大西洋山脊名目收集了這個海底山脊區域的個樣本。

sentences.english: In Paris, numerous reception, buffet is a good opportunity to make friends.
sentences.chinese: 在巴黎，名目繁多酒會，冷餐會是廣交朋友好機會。

sentences.english: Have you checked in the catalogue under author and title?
sentences.chinese: 你查過作者和書名目錄沒有？

sentences.english: The same items appear on the chef's menus in his U.S. restaurants.
sentences.chinese: 一份相同的名目也會出現在美國餐館的廚師菜單上。

sentences.english: Perhaps, because there is simply nothing to accuse him of?
sentences.chinese: 或許，其實只是因爲沒有名目可以用來指控他？

sentences.english: Some government departments try in a hundred and one ways to collect money by inventing different names.
sentences.chinese: 第二句說有些政府部門千方百計巧立名目來撈錢。

definition: names of many kinds (idiom); items of every description
to fabricate excuses (idiom)/to concoct various items (e.g. to pad an expense account)

to make use of/to use sth as pretext/under false pretenses/under the guise of/masquerading as/lenient/tolerant/loan character (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/character acquiring meanings by phonetic association/also called phonetic loan
objectionable practices
in great abundance/numerous
shop sign/signboard/(fig.) pretense
miscellaneous duties/various taxes
military banner/flag signal/(fig.) banner (i.e. false pretenses)
to apportion expenses, responsibilities etc/to demand contributions
taxes and levies
to collect money/to raise funds (for charity)
lawless/illegal/unlawful
to accumulate wealth/to rake in money
exorbitant taxation (idiom)
by no means an isolated case/numerous
see 抵充[di3 chong1]
